{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.03237v1", "title": "Well-balanced POD-based reduced-order models for finite volume
  approximation of hyperbolic balance laws", "summary": "This paper introduces a reduced-order modeling approach based on finite
volume methods for hyperbolic systems, combining Proper Orthogonal
Decomposition (POD) with the Discrete Empirical Interpolation Method (DEIM) and
Proper Interval Decomposition (PID). Applied to systems such as the transport
equation with source term, non-homogeneous Burgers equation, and shallow water
equations with non-flat bathymetry and Manning friction, this method achieves
significant improvements in computational efficiency and accuracy compared to
previous time-averaging techniques. A theoretical result justifying the use of
well-balanced Full-Order Models (FOMs) is presented. Numerical experiments
validate the approach, demonstrating its accuracy and efficiency. Furthermore,
the question of prediction of solutions for systems that depend on some
physical parameters is also addressed, and a sensitivity analysis on POD
parameters confirms the model's robustness and efficiency in this case.", "main_category": "math.NA", "categories": "math.NA,cs.NA", "published": "2025-05-06T07:05:56Z"}
